Description.val:
This line item funds modifications to the C-17 aircraft.  The United States Air Force (USAF) C-17 inventory is 222 aircraft.  The four engine C-17 is the only aircraft capable of routine delivery of outsize cargo (tanks, helicopters, etc.) to short, austere airfields.  The aircraft can carry up to 102 troops, 36 litter patients, or 18 standard 463-L pallets.

Major C-17 modifications in FY19 include Pylon Stub Flammable Fluid Leakage Zone (FFLZ) Fixed Fairing (FF) Translating Fairing, Identification Friend or Foe Global Air Traffic Management (IFF GATM) and Automatic Dependent Surveillance - Broadcast Out (ADS-B Out).  The ADS-B Out installations are scheduled to meet the 1 Jan 2020 FAA mandate.

Funding may be used to address Diminishing Manufacturing Sources (DMS) issues.

In accordance with Section 1815 of the FY08 National Defense Authorization Act (P.L.110-181), these items are necessary for use by the active and reserve components of the Armed Forces for homeland defense missions, domestic emergency responses and providing military support to civil authorities.

FY 2019 funding transfer in from O&M $.896M for Rapid Global Mobility Live Virtual Construct program.

Funding for this exhibit is contained in PE 0401130F.

Justification.val: Where applicable, justification for individual modifications is provided in the P-3A exhibits.

Name.val: Pylon Stub FFLZ, FF, Translating Fairing
Beyond Line of Sight (BLOS) Comm Mod
C-17 Simulator Lateral Motion Maneuver Enhancement
Beyond Line of Sight (BLOS) Aero I/H
C-17 Real Time In the Cockpit (RTIC)

Description.val:
This modification effort is an ACAT III program for modernization of the C-17 on the Air Force Acquisition Master List (AML).  This effort is for development, integration and installation of a Replacement Heads-Up Display (RHUD) onto the C-17 aircraft.  Analysis indicates the current HUD, which is required to fly the C-17, is becoming unsupportable due to obsolescence.  This effort will retrofit the C-17 fleet with an RHUD that is supportable and provides improved reliability, maintainability, and supportability, while providing growth to support future planned capability improvements.  The RHUD is scheduled to complete all installs by CY26.  

Projected allocations by component are subject to total force mission priorities and aircraft availability.

Funding may be used to address Diminishing Manufacturing Sources (DMS) issues.

Milestone/Development Status

The first RHUD will be tested with RDT&E funding in FY18.  The first production kitproof kits will be purchased in FY18 for FY19 installation.

ModificationTitle.val: Automatic Dependent Surveillance - Broadcast Out (ADS-B Out)

Description.val:
The Phase I portion of this modification effort is part of the Common Configuration acquisition program.  The C-17 Common Configuration program consists of multiple development, integration and retrofit projects to support achievement of the Block 19-21 common configuration and the homogeneous fleet configuration.

Phase I - Surveillance Enhancements (FY15-FY18) will integrate an improved surveillance capability to meet new requirements for global civil airspace access and for safe operations in military-controlled airspace.  This project will provide Automatic Dependent Surveillance - Broadcast (ADS-B) Out capability to meet mandated civil airspace requirements. Phase I installs will be performed concurrently with the Identification Friend or Foe (IFF) Global Air Traffic Management (GATM) installation.  The ADS-B Out installations are scheduled to meet the 1 Jan 2020 FAA mandate.

ADS-B Kit consists of:
ARINC 429 Cable
APX-119-531 Software Update
Precision Landing System Receiver (PLSR) -12 configuration

Funding may be used for Diminishing Manufacturing Sources (DMS) issues. Projected allocations by component are subject to total force mission priorities and aircraft availability.

Milestone/Development Status

Development complete.  Installs begin in FY18.  ADS-B installations began during in 1QFY18 and will conclude in 2QFY20.

A C-17 Fixed Installation Satellite Antenna (FISA) enables high bandwidth (military or commercial) satellite communications, allowing for greater, in flight situational awareness.  Capabilities include en route-beyond line of sight communications, Video teleconferencing, mission rehearsal, and upload/download of large graphic files.

Funding may be used to procure additional FISA systems and/or procurement of next-gen FISA systems. 

Funding may be used for Diminishing Manufacturing Sources (DMS) issues. Projected allocations by component subject to total force mission priorities and aircraft availability.

Milestone/Development Status

Development Complete

ModificationTitle.val: C-17 Visual System Field of View

Title.val: C-17 Visual System Field of View

Name.val: C-17 Visual System Field of View:INSTALL KITS Group A (Active)

Description.val:
Increase Field Of View (FOV) to replicate visual references used during air refueling. Increased FOV enhances Distributed Mission Operations (DMO) Air refueling training. Mobility Air Forces (MAF) training supports the modification and enhancement of high fidelity MAF aircrew training and support systems to ensure full employment of DMO capabilities to meet combat readiness training needs. Use of DMO-Capable trainers, instead of the aircraft, provides a cost effective means of conducting daily training, mission rehearsal, joint forces exercises, tactics development activity, and Virtual Aerial Refueling (VAR).

DMS efforts to include removal of end-of-life software/hardware within simulators systems and move to a modular, common open system architecture that is sustainable and cyber-resilient. Implement requirements and standards defined under the Simulator Common Architecture Requirements and Standards (SCARS) initiative.

Milestone/Development Status

Development complete.
